conclusion: Understand the process and how work is calculated in a thermodynamic cycle.
Transition from state D to state A is along a constant pressure path at pressure P1.
In an isobaric process, the work done by the gas is given by W = P ΔV.
Volume at state D is V2 and at state A is V1.
Change in volume ΔV is V1 - V2.
Calculate work done: W_DA = P1 (V1 - V2).
Since V1 < V2, V1 - V2 is negative, indicating compression work.
The work done by the gas on the surroundings is P1 (V1 - V2), which is negative.
The gas is not doing work on the surroundings during this transition.
